name.description: Name of the workspace. First project's name will be used if not specified.

projects.description: List of projects belonging to the workspace

name.description: Name of the project. Use only characters allowed in file names.

type.description: Type of the project (causes different build results)

oneOf.title: An executable application (EXE on Windows systems).
A library that is compiled into binaries while linking (integrated into one file, bigger file sizes).
A project that doesn't result in a binary itself, instead it provides configuration to other projects.
C++ (standard: C++0x - the prepublish version of C++11)
C++ (standard: C++1y - the prepublish version of C++14)
C++ (standard: C++1z - the prepublish version of C++17)

files.description:
Files that this project uses.
Either a single file, a file pattern or array of files/file patterns.
A file pattern uses asterisk as a wildcard, f.e.: "src/*.cpp".
A double wildcard will search subfolders too: "src/**.cpp".
More examples:
"files": [ "src/Hello.hpp", "src/Hello.cpp", "src/Main.cpp" ]
"files": [ "src1/*.cpp", "src2/*.cpp" ]

linkedLibraries.description:
Library dependencies of this project.
This is a structure of three values: public, private and interface.
When using string or array to define this field, values will be considered as public.

defines.description:
Preprocessor definitions.
Examples:
"defines": [
	"DEBUG",
	"FOO=123"
].
This is a structure of three values: public, private and interface.
When using string or array to define this field, values will be considered as public.

includeFolders.description:
Folders used by the compiler to locate project files.
This is a structure of three values: public, private and interface.
When using string or array to define this field, values will be considered as public.

linkerFolders.description:
Folders used by the linker to locate library dependencies.
This is a structure of three values: public, private and interface.
When using string or array to define this field, values will be considered as public.

public.decription: Values used by the current project and propagated to projects that use it as a dependency.

private.decription: Values used by the current project only.

interface.decription: Values propagated to projects that use the current project as a dependency.
